channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Stretch of road has defects, 14th August
item.description:
The stretch of road opposite New Dawn housing has defects in the repaired pot holes. Indulations, broken edges, holes. It is not just one pot hole. I’m finding it very dangerous to cycle over and unable to avoid when vehicles pass me. This whole section needs resurfacing!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Empty beer barrels and wood planks dumped on roadway, 14th August
item.description:
These barrels and wood planks have been dumped on the public highway for many days/a few weeks. There is no sign of intention to clear them off the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Montpellier Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is a 3 way traffic lights. The pedestrian lights do not park and pedestrian cannot see what the traffic lights are on and so unable to know which lane of traffic is moving to be able to cross safely. This junction has become very busy with cars, lorries and buses. The lights haven’ t worked for months ., 14th August
item.description:

item.title: Blocked drains, 14th August
item.description:
As previously reported a year or so ago following the resurfacing of Prestbury Rd several of the drains are blocked. These drains are on ALL exits of the roundabout of Prestbury Rd, Pittville Circus Rd etc. Following the previous reporting if blockages i was informed that work would and subsequently was carried out to unblock said drains...as you can see that was not quite truthful. Please send another crew out who are up to the task and stop wasting residents time if they've taken time out of their day to use your website to inform your relevant departments of issues that need to be looked at and resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees in neighbouring gardens and broken fence along footpath, 14th August
item.description:
From Pirton Lane to Andorra Way. The vegetation from the verge along the A40 is now encroaching along the whole pathway and overhanging onto gardens. There are trees that have grown into neighbouring fences and need to be removed before the fences are damaged. The trees have never been cut back and if you walk along during the winter you get soaked from the overhanging branches. The concrete post and wire fence is broken at Keriston Avenue allowing pedestrians to walk through the long grass verge and not stick to the footpath making the avenue treacherous in the winter, with mud and dog faeces being trodden along the Avenue. Not a healthy route for school children to take and as the dark nights draw in, the lights along the footpath cannot be seen due to the overhanging branches making the footpath dangerous and difficult to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keriston Avenue, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
